synopsis: In the year 2122 it seems that everybody has their own Medabot - everyone except Ikki Tenryou that is. Unable to afford a new model, Ikki is reluctant to buy the old model on sale in the local store. But when a gang of Rockers starts to terrorize his classmates, Ikki is forced to step in and fight with a damaged medal and an old model. Can this rookie team save the day or will they be all washed up before they begin?

Thanks to Erika's report of their victory over the Rockers, Ikki and Metabee become famous. As other Medafighters challenge them to battle, the pair must take on Peppercat and Samantha, leader of The Screws. But how can they defeat their opponent when they are fighting with each other?

title.jp: Otoko no Yume wa Tairyoku Da

synopsis: After finding Ikki and The Screws with their Medabots, the school gym coach makes them all run laps as punishment. Wondering why the coach hates Medabots so much, Ikki and the others spy on him and discover that he has a Medabot of his own.

Ikki and Erika meet Kouji and Karin, two posh kids from the nearby private school. When rumors spread that a Legendary Medafighter is at the school, the pair decide to sneak in. Could there be any link between their new friends and the mysterious adversary or is it all a coincidence?

Ikki and Metabee learn an important lesson about surroundings when they are defeated at the beach by a group of bullies. Can the old sea master of the beach help them reclaim Metabee's legs or is Sharkkan too powerful on the aquatic battlefield?

When nobody believes that a UFO landed on her front yard, Erika tries to bring out the truth. Meanwhile the Rubber Robo Gang decide to make money selling alien merchandise.

(Source: TV.com)

Note: Episode 8 in the Nelvana English dubbed version.

Hearing reports of ghosts stealing people's medals in the forest, Ikki and Erika decide to investigate. There they find Karin and Kouji, who are also out looking for the Gimme Ghost. But is the ghost real, and what does the Rubber Robo Gang have to do with things?

(Source: TV.com)

Note: Episode 6 in the Nelvana English dubbed version.

Ikki and Erika decide to do a report on Medabots and Medafighters for school. Metabee finds a Mermaid Medal while strolling. They put the medal into Brass and they find out that the medal was lost when her Medafighter had to move somewhere else and forgot her medal. Metabee insists on reuniting Oceana and her Medafighter Hannah. When they find her, they find out that Oceana's body was lost during the move too. Erika, being the great investigator that she is, locates the guy who found Oceana's body, but he refuses to give it back. Now Metabee has to Ro-Battle Kuraba, a Crab type Medabot, to win her body back.

(Source: TV.com)

Note: Episode 32 in the Nelvana English dubbed version.

Spyke and Cyandog never seem to win a Robattle so Samantha kicks him them out of the Screws gang. Spyke and Cyandog ask Metabee and Ikki for training help and they find out that Cyandog is terrible at battle because he has the wrong type of medal.

(Source: TV.com)

Note: Episode 7 in the Nelvana English dubbed version.

Ikki and Metabee decide to enter the 10th Annual Medabot Citywide Robattle Tournament, but with the two still fighting each other can they hope to defeat their opponents? Team or no team, the pair will have to fight harder than ever before if they hope to beat the power team of Kouji and Sumilidon.

(Source: TV.com)

Note: Episode 8 in the Nelvana English dubbed version.

Still bitter from their arguments, Metabee decides to ignore Ikki in the final Robattle against Sumilidon. While Kouji demands a rematch when the pair are working together, the Rubber Robo Gang steals Metabee's medal. Could this be the end for Ikki and Metabee's partnership?

(Source: TV.com)

Note: Episode 9 in the Nelvana English dubbed version.

Ikki and Metabee encounter the mysterious Rokusho, a lone Medabot whose past is shrouded in mystery. Although somewhat apprehensive about this newcomer, Rokusho proves himself to the pair when the Rubber Robo Gang attacks Ikki's house.

(Source: TV.com)

Note: Episode 10 in the Nelvana English dubbed version.

Samantha has a hard choice to make. Give up Robattling, so she could stay with her "true love" (who actually doesn't like Medabots) or forget about him and continue as a Medafighter. She decides to quit Robatting for Nathan, who doesn't like Medafighters because he lost to Samantha years back. Now, Samantha has an even harder decision. Will she lose purposefully to help her true love get his spirit back?

(Source: TV.com)

Note: Episode 28 in the Nelvana English dubbed version.

When Ikki wins two free tickets to popular Ninja Park, Erika persuades him to take her as his free guest. Ikki's first choice was Karin, but Erika wants to do a story on the park. Ikki reluctantly agrees because Erika took one ticket and wouldn't give it back. The main attractions to the park are the Explosive Ninja Show that features Ninja-Type Medabot Nin-Ninja and Kunoichi (Female Ninja)-Type Medabot Icknite, as well as the Ninja Castle that says closed for renovations. Disappointed, Ikki and Erika proceed to the Ninja Show. As the Ninja Show begins, Ikki and Erika notice that the monsters in the show look very much like the Rubberobo Gang. Seaslug has decided to hold Ikki and Erika captive until renovations are completed on their new base Ninja Castle! The Rubberobo Gang has stolen the Medals of Nin-Ninja and Icknite, and has complete control over them. Intuitively knowing that Ikki and Erika are in trouble, Metabee and Sailor-Multi (nicknamed Brass) come to their rescue. As the decisive tag-team Robattle commences, Ikki and Erika must learn the basics of team play to complement each other's strengths, and cooperative strategies that minimize wasted movements. Brass detects the Ninjas with her radar when they attempt to use a Ninja camouflage technique, and Metabee fires his missiles in the direction she gives. Using teamwork they are able to defeat the Ninjas.

(Source: TV.com)

Note: Episode 33 in the Nelvana English dubbed version.

While traveling across the nation, training to become the best in the country, a Medafighter stops at Ikki's home. He is looking for a blue and white Medabot that interrupted his training in the mountains. The Medafighter tells Ikki that over 100 Medabots attacked him at one time and defeated his Kintarou-Type Medabot Kintarou. He can't remember seeing an Medafighter, and only remembers a white and blue Medabot with horns. A blue and white Medabot with no Medafighter? That description fits Rokusho, but he can't possibly be the one that did this terrible thing, can he? When Rokusho is confronted, the truth is revealed - it was indeed Rokusho who interrupted their training, but for good reason. Acting alone, Rokusho did this because they were cutting down trees during their training. He stopped their training not with force but with compassion. This sounds more like the Rokusho that we know!

(Source: TV.com)

Note: Episode 34 in the Nelvana English dubbed version.

Spring is in the air, and like flowers, the hearts of men are blooming for Miss Mimosa, a popular teacher at Ikki's school. Coach Mountain, Squidguts, and the local florist, Mr. Richards all want to confess their love for Miss Mimosa but are too shy. Not surprisingly, Mr. Richards tries to express his feelings with flowers. But now someone is stalking Miss Mimosa by making crank telephone calls, following her home and breaking into her classroom. They discover that Mr. Richards' Medabot Flower-Type Medabot FLORO is the culprit. He tried to act as a go-between by calling her at home and visiting the school, all in an attempt to bring Mr. Richards and Miss Mimosa together. Then, just like his Medafighter, FLORO became shy and nervous when he approached her.

(Source: TV.com)

Note: Episode 35 in the Nelvana English dubbed version.

Believing Ikki to be the Phantom Renegade, a reporter decides to stalk him to uncover evidence. When that doesn't work, he decides to mimic the masked stranger in order to draw the truth from Ikki, but the real Phantom Renegade isn't too pleased that somebody is pretending to be him.

(Source: TV.com)

Note: Episode 11 in the Nelvana English dubbed version.

Frustrated by Medabots, a group of mothers decide to confiscate them all and lock them away. Can Ikki and Metabee convince the band of parents to give back the town's Medabots or is parent power one force they can't defeat?

(Source: TV.com)

Note: Episode 12 in the Nelvana English dubbed version.

Penguins are cute with their black and white bodies and small wings, and the unique way they waddle when they walk. When they stare at you with those beady eyes, it just takes your breath away! Along with a little boy named Paco and his Medabot Pingen, Ikki and his friends break into a strange animal park operated by the Rubberobo Gang to help send hundreds of penguins back to their home in Antarctica. Pingen, a Penguin Type Medabot that is not suited for battle because of its weak armor, was a present from Paco's dad in Antarctica to keep Paco company while he is away. Rubberobo's plan was to build a zoo to raise funds for taking over the world! The mistake was trying to make a zoo with only penguins. Their bizarre plans were spoiled when Pingen, Paco and his new friends succeed in setting the penguins free. Ikki and the others are happy to help send the penguins home to Antarctica, but hate to say goodbye to Pingen.

(Source: TV.com)

Note: Episode 36 in the Nelvana English dubbed version.

The Rubber Robo Gang come up with a plan to use Ikki and Metabee to steal a super rare medal from Dr Aki, the creator of Medabots who also happens to be Karin's uncle.

(Source: TV.com)

Note: Episode 13 in the Nelvana English dubbed version.

The Rubber Robo Gang breaks into the Medabot Corporation, hoping to steal the rare medals kept inside. Metabee, Brass and Neutranurse fight to protect the corporation's possessions, but when the villains get their hands on the mighty Belzelga things look bad for Ikki and company.

(Source: TV.com)

Note: Episode 14 in the Nelvana English dubbed version.

Ikki and Metabee are being trained by Dr. Aki to become top-level, highly skilled fighters for Robattle. The doctor visits a friend of his, Kailey, the famous stunt pilot. Kailey and her Plane-Type Medabot Femjet are practicing their aerodynamic moves when Femjet is unable to pull out of a dive and crashes into the forest. Kailey explains that three months ago at the City Airshow, she made a mistake on her landing and Femjet crashed badly. Ever since that crash, Femjet has been afraid of flying. Ikki suggests that Metabee and Femjet train together so Metabee can learn flying battle techniques while Femjet regains her confidence and aero-form. Kailey flat out rejects Ikki's offer. Feeling slighted, he challenges her to a Robattle. She agrees, and Mr. Referee officially declares the start of the match. Unfortunately, Metabee has only homemade aero-parts to use, and is unable to move. He ultimately defeats himself with his own missiles! Observing how easily Femjet defeats Metabee, the Rubberobo Gang decides to kidnap Femjet to obtain her Medal. To their dismay, it isn't a Rare Medal after all. Then Femjet, overcoming her fear of flying, teams with Metabee to battle the Rubberobo Gang's Dragonfly-Type Medabot , Drakonfly.

(Source: TV.com)

Note: Episode 37 in the Nelvana English dubbed version.

Rokusho befriends Ainsley, a widow who lost her husband in war. After sleeping under Ainsley's tree causes Rokusho to remember some of his history with Professor Hushi, he and Ainsley decide to protect the tree from the Rubber Robo Gang who believe that there may be a rare medal hidden inside it.

(Source: TV.com)

Note: Episode 15 in the Nelvana English dubbed version.

Karin is having a costume party and invited everyone, from Ikki, Erika, and Metabee (who are real glad to be invited) to Samantha and the rest of the Screws (who were surprised to get an invite). Koji decides to confess his love to Karin at her party. Just as he's about to confess his love, the Rubber Robo Gang crashes the party and with all the confusion, Kouji confesses his love to Samatha, by accident. But she thinks he's really telling the truth.

(Source: TV.com)

Note: Episode 29 in the Nelvana English dubbed version.

More secrets of Rokusho's past are revealed when he discovers than Dr Aki was the one who set fire to Professor Hushi's house. When Rokusho prepares to exact his revenge on the doctor, Metabee intervenes and challenges his mysterious ally to a Robattle. The battle seems to be going Metabee's way, but the mysterious Rokusho has a trick up his sleeve - the Medaforce. Is there anything that can stand in the way of such a devastating attack?

(Source: TV.com)

Note: Episode 16 in the Nelvana English dubbed version.

Rokusho seeks revenge for Professor Hushi's death, leaving Metabee to take on the powerful Robo-Emperor alone. Despite his best efforts, the common Medabot may be no match for the might of Dr Meta-Evil's creation. But everything may not be as it seems as Ikki learns more about Professor Hushi's mysterious past.

(Source: TV.com)

Note: Episode 17 in the Nelvana English dubbed version.

After learning that they are the third best team in Japan, Ikki and Metabee become cocky until a robattle against Samantha teaches them that they cannot rely on the Medaforce. Realizing that they must continue to hone their basic skills, the pair must prove that they deserve their ranking against a new opponent, Mr Dragon.

(Source: TV.com)

Note: Episode 18 in the Nelvana English dubbed version.

In Ikki's neighborhood, a cart from Osaka that sells fried octopus balls sets up shop. Despite their good taste, Ikki voices his discontent, since he is a connoisseur of fried octopus balls. Natalie was upset and stayed up all night trying to perfect her recipe. The next day, she was enjoying a good crowd around her cart and again Ikki stopped by to taste her product. Unfortunately, he was once again not satisfied by the taste. Giving Natalie Ikki's attention and valuable advice, Natalie does not get upset, but instead falls in love with Ikki. Natalie is greatly troubled when she finds out that Ikki is ranked third in the nation of all Medafighters. Natalie must decide between her affection for Ikki, and her desire to eliminate him from the competition so she can compete in the World Robattle Tournament and promote her father's fried octopus ball recipe. Very distracted by the smell of fried octopus balls, Ikki almost loses a Robattle to the Clam-Type Octoclam Medabot.

(Source: TV.com)

Note: Episode 38 in the Nelvana English dubbed version.

A snow storm causes the school to be closed. Ikki and Erika are having a snowball fight with the Screws and don't hear the no-school announcement. Still thinking they have school, Ikki, Erika, and the Screws all report to school and are surprised to find no one there. They decide to go home after a while, but they meet up with Tom and Snowbro, who supposedly are the #1 team in Canada. Metabee gets frozen with Snowbro's special attack, but quickly thaws and gets back into action.

(Source: TV.com)

Note: Episode 30 in the Nelvana English dubbed version.

Spyke and Cyandog argue with each other and the two end up going their separate ways, with Cyandog deciding to join The Rockers. Determined not to show how much he misses his old Medabot, Spyke buys a Krosserdog Medabot but it just isn't the same without his old buddy. The two eventually reunite, but the turn of events leaves Cyandog's medal in Krosserdog's body, giving Spyke his old friend in a new way.

(Source: TV.com)

Note: Episode 39 in the Nelvana English dubbed version.

Ikki and Metabee try to work out the identities of the mysterious Medabots that attacked them, but are distracted when an impostor seems to be ruining their name with another Metabee. How is the new kid, Rintarou, connected to all of these goings on?

(Source: TV.com)

Note: Episode 19 in the Nelvana English dubbed version.

Space Medafighter X and Arcbeetle challenge Shrimpy Lipowitz to a Robattle to win back Metabee's medal, but Ikki's loss has knocked them from their third place ranking. Looking to train and improve their skills, the pair are dragged to a dojo by Rintarou, but there they discover that the dojo leader may not be who he appears.

(Source: TV.com)

Note: Episode 20 in the Nelvana English dubbed version.

Space Medafighter X goes to share information with Koji on how he can compete against Ikki and Metabee's Rare Medal. Although Koji can't invoke the Medaforce, there are ways to combat it. Still ranked at only number four, Ikki desperately looks for a new opponent to Robattle in order to regain his top three ranking. Squidguts and Samurai-Type Medabot Gobanko spread the word that they are looking for a Robattle with a formidable opponent. They wait for Ikki and Metabee on top of a pedestrian bridge. When doing battle against Squidguts, Metabee is again able to summon the power of the Medaforce to defeat his opponent.

(Source: TV.com)

Note: Episode 31 in the Nelvana English dubbed version.

Seeking a way to defeat the Medaforce, Kouji and Sumilidon are taught the Shadow Sword technique by Space Medafighter X. As the pair practice using this new technique, Ikki and Metabee realize that they may be in trouble and seek a way to counter this new attack. Both teams are determined to win, but only one can be victorious.

(Source: TV.com)

Note: Episode 21 in the Nelvana English dubbed version.

Forced to choose between reclaiming their ranking and saving Ikki's mom, Ikki and Metabee decide to do the right thing. Infiltrating the Rubber Robo Gang's lair, the two must fight their way to where Mrs Tenryou is being held captive. But will Metabee be able to survive so many robattles without a chance to rest, and what about their ranking?!

(Source: TV.com)

Note: Episode 22 in the Nelvana English dubbed version.

Determined to reclaim his third place ranking, Ikki challenges Space Medafighter X to a Robattle. With a little help from his friends, Metabee is stronger than ever, but even that may not be enough to defeat Japan's top Medafighter. To make matters worse, the Rubber Robo Gang still has one last dirty trick up their sleeve.

(Source: TV.com)

Note: Episode 23 in the Nelvana English dubbed version.

Weakened by recent events, Metabee is easily captured by the Rubber Robo Gang when they swoop in to bot-nap him. Ikki and the others are determined to rescue their friend before the Rubber Robos can steal his medal, but first they'll have to find their secret hideout.

(Source: TV.com)

Note: Episode 24 in the Nelvana English dubbed version.

Dr. Meta-Evil uses Metabee's medal to control every beetle-type Medabot in the world! Brass starts to attack Erika and Karin while Kantaroth starts attacking Rintarou and his group. Then, amazingly, we find out that Dr. Meta Evil was once Professor Hushi's assistant. Professor Hushi found out the power of the rare medals and he wanted to destroy all of his findings and research but Dr. Meta-Evil stole the information to use it for evil. More surprises are in store when it's revealed that Dr. Meta-Evil is part machine himself! Peppercat and Sumilidon attack him but are unable to do much damage. Rokushou distracts the Evil Doctor as Ikki sets Metabee free. When he does that, the curse is broken.

(Source: TV.com)

Note: Episode 25 in the Nelvana English dubbed version.

title.jp: Shakunetsu no Final Robottle (灼熱の最終

synopsis:
Dr. Meta-Evil seems to be defeated but the battle is not over. The Doctor's strange cat ejects Meta-Evil's medal and places it in to a huge Medabot called Giganko. With its unreal strength, even with Metabee, Rokushou, and ArcBeetle working together they can only barely hold their own. Even when all 3 of them use the Medaforce, it only halts Giganko for a moment. Giganko goes into town destroying everything in sight. Ikki realizes that Giganko can be defeated by removing its medal just like any Medabot. At the last minute, Ikki manages to eject the medal, ending the battle. Finally, Ikki is told that because of his final battle with Seaslug (or Seymour Slugbottoms) he has returned to 3rd Place in the Robattle Rankings thereby allowing him to participate in the Championships.

(Source: TV.com)

Note: Episode 26 in the Nelvana English dubbed version.

As competitors from around the world gather for the start of the World Robattle Championships, Mr Referee is shocked to be informed of a new rule for the contest. As Ikki and Kouji meet up, they worry that Space Medafighter X might not turn up for the competition and that they will be disqualified, however Ikki and Metabee have more important things to worry about when they immediately get off on the wrong foot with world champion Victor of Team Kenya. When Ikki learns that an exhibition match between Team Kenya and Team Japan will be held during the opening ceremonies, he and Metabee look forward to taking Victor on, until Space Medafighter X fails to turn up for the opening ceremony. As the teams are all introduced, Mr Referee reluctantly announces the new ruling for the championship, that the loser of each robattle must give up their medal to the winner. The stunned players take in the news as the exhibition match begins, but with Space Medafighter X still a no show, Team Japan is about to be disqualified as Karen turns up in his place. As the exhibition match starts, Team Japan is no match for the power of Victor and the rest of Team Kenya, but the time limit runs out and the three friends narrowly avoid defeat. But after such a shocking first bout is there any hope for Team Japan once the contest gets started for real.

After their near defeat in the exhibition match, Ikki and Kouji are worried about how they will fare in the championship, especially as Space Medafighter X still hasn't turned up. While the two start arguing about who is going to be team leader, they rescue a little girl from the Caribbean team and let her watch them training. When the robattle begins later that day, Karen has to take MedaX's place yet again, but as the robattle begins they realize that the girl they helped was actually the daughter of Team Caribbean's leader. As the Caribbean rips through Team Japan, the three have to work together in order to defeat their opponents and make it through to the next round. With the three friends finally working together, Henry decides that it is time for the real Space Medafighter X to make his appearance, but how will the team fare against the rest of the opposition.

Ikki and Kouji become suspicious when they learn that Team France has won all of their matches by default because their opponents have failed to turn up. When Metabee's medal goes missing, the gang suspects that Team France have stolen it, but find that their opponents are able to dress up like other people, making them hard to catch. As the gang tries to recover their medals, Team France kidnaps Karin, so Samantha has to stand in as Space Medafighter X, but as the Robattle prepares to begin, the real Space Medafighter X (a.k.a Phantom Renegade) has switched places with one of the members of Team France and so the team has to forfeit the match, meaning that Team Japan advances automatically.

Samantha is training for both the coming robattle and a ballet recital. To make matters worse they're scheduled on the same day. Samantha really wants to impress her mom, but she doesn't want to disappoint her team.

As Team Japan prepares for their fourth round match against Team Sweden, Ikki, Kouji and Sloane (Space Medafighter X) are all infatuated by the three beautiful girls that make up the team. As Spyke and the girls try to snap them out of it, it seems like there is nothing they can do to get the guys to practice. When the match begins, it seems like Team Sweden is in for an easy victory, until the Phantom Renegade reveals that Team Sweden are actually male Rubberrobo Gang members dressed up like beautiful women. Furious that they have been tricked so easily, Metabee wipes out his opponents using the Medaforce, taking Team Japan through to the final eight.

Ikki, Kouji and Spyke (Space Medafighter X) find themselves up against Team Egypt in the quarter finals, but when the leader of the team, Patra, warns them that they can't win until they identify their weakest link, Kouji is sure that she means Spyke because he has the weakest Medabot. As the three begin training, Spyke tries his hardest but Kouji tells him to just stay out of the way and leave him and Ikki to do the robattling. However as the robattle begins and Team Egypt takes an early lead, Patra informs Kouji that he is the weakest member of the team. As a stunned Kouji tries to take in what his opponent has told him, it's up to Spyke to save the day and stop Team Egypt from winning the robattle. Meanwhile, Ikki and Rintarou learn about the Ten Days of Darkness that occurred during the WRC eight years ago and Ikki is stunned to learn that the competitor who caused the incident (the same Henry who Rintarou is obsessed with) caused the Ten Days while using a Metabee.

Stunned by the news that Hikaru Agata and Metabee caused the Ten Days of Darkness at the WRC eight years ago, Ikki and the others head off to find Henry, certain that he knows more than he is letting on about the incident. On the way, Ikki explains that Henry suggested the name Metabee, and he thinks that Henry and Hikaru may be one and the same. While the gang have no luck finding Henry, Kouji is in shock after seeing how he almost let the team down against Patra and Team Egypt. As a disheartened Kouji wonders how he can help the team without being able to use the Medaforce, a confrontation between Joe, the leader of Team USA, and Space Medafighter X results in the real Medafighter agreeing to fight in the semi-finals. As the robattle begins, Kouji is unable to fight and Team Japan looks set for an early defeat, but as Arcbeetle seemingly destroys both Team USA's Medabots and Metabee as well, Sumilodon jumps in, rescuing his team mate. Determined not to lose, Joe reveals his secret move, the Destroyer Mirage and looks set to win the battle, especially when he evades the Medaforce. But with Metabee reeling from his miss, Sumilodon successfully uses the force, destroying Wigwamo and winning the match for the team.

Team Japan's day off goes in unsuspected ways when Dr Aki insists that he check out why Sumilodon was able to use the Medaforce. Leaving Kouji behind, Ikki and Erika head off in search of Team Iceland to check out the competition, but Erika soon falls in love with team leader Belmont. When Belmont falls ill saving Erika, she feels guilty that he might not be able to compete and pleads with Victor to postpone the match but he refuses. The match goes on as planned and although Belmont fights valiantly, Warbandit is too powerful and Team Kenya wins the second place in the finals, taking Orkamar's medal as their prize. While Belmont mourns the loss, Ikki vows to win back the medal by defeating Victor in the finals, however Brass tries to explain that Warbandit told her that Victor does not want to take the medals, but is doing it for another reason.

As Team Iceland recovers from their defeat, everyone is in shock as the board of directors for the World Medabot Corporation reveals themselves to be the Rubberrobo Gang. While Ikki tries to take in the news, Kouji is pleased to hear that Sumilodon should be fine to battle in the finals, however things won't be easy against the World Champion, Victor. Seeing the Robos on television, Miss Caviar recognises Seaslug as the man she fell in love with and tries to talk to him, but when he ignores her she vows revenge, forcing Dr Aki and the Phantom Renegade to let her be Space Medafighter X in the final round. Meanwhile Rokushou learns that Victor has been hired by the Rubberrobos and warns Ikki, who confronts Victor when Mrs Tenryou accidentally invites him home for dinner. During the meal, Victor tells Ikki more about the horrors of the Ten Days of Darkness, but even after hearing his warnings, Ikki is still determined to beat Victor and win back Orkamar's medal for Belmont. As Team Japan prepares for the final round, none of them knows what to expect, but working as a team they are sure that they will be victorious.

As the finals of the WRC begin, Miss Caviar (as Space Medafighter X) heats things by making a special announcement to the head of the Medabot Corporation, Seaslug. If Team Japan wins the Cup, then Seaslug must quite the Rubberrobos, however if Team Kenya wins, Miss Caviar will join the Robos. As the robattle begins, both teams are on top form and it looks like it could be anyone's game. But as the two teams fight on, Medabots are destroyed one-by-one until only Metabee and Warbandit are left. A crushing blow from Warbandit almost destroys Metabee and in the process fries Ikki's medawatch. Certain that he has won, Victor prepares to leave the stage, but Metabee refuses to give up, summoning the Medaforce to eliminate his opponent. But when Warbandit also summons the Medaforce, the two blasts hit each other head on and the stadium is filled with light...

The violent combination of Metabee and Warbandit's Medaforce blasts shakes the whole stadium, as, far beneath the arena, Rokusho and the Phantom Renegade discover that the Rubberrobo Gang's hideout has been beneath the Medadome all along. They discover a massive resonating antenna, and the Phantom recognizes the truth, racing to tell Doctor Aki while Rokusho takes on a team of Whitesords. Warbandit and Metabee, meanwhile, appear caught in a state of suspended animation, and, in a dream state, deep in the recess of his own mind, Metabee sees a world devastated by war. Victor and Ikki bring their Medabots around, but the strength of their robattle spirit is affect both their medals, and the medals of all the other Medabots around them - and the Phantom Renegade suddenly appears to explain why! The entire stadium is a gigantic resonance device, harnessing the energies of the rare medals and spreading it's effect to all the medals within. The Phantom warns that if the battle does not stop, the events of the Ten Days of Darkness will repeat themselves, but both Warbandit and Metabee are so determined that not even their Medafighters can stop them. When they both unleash the Medaforce once more, the resonance reaches critical limit, and the antennae beneath the stadium broadcast the effect all across the Earth, plunging Medabots all across the planet into trances. Mr. Referee quits after Seaslug and the Rubberrobos reveal that this has always been their intention, and Doctor Meta-Evil makes his grand entrance. Miss Caviar tells Doctor Aki to flee with the rest of the spectators, so he can activate the emergency shut down that will deactivate Medabots worldwide - but the stadium and the Rubberrobo headquarters are now airborne! Metabee, meanwhile, awakes to find himself in a beautiful paradise... where has his mind retreated to?

Metabee finds himself in a paradise... a world of Medabots, but no humans, where a Medabot who is apparently Brass calls him "Kyuumu." Doctor Meta-Evil reveals that he thinks of himself as a Medabot, having cybernetically enhanced his body. Then, he delivers the ultimate revelation... Eons ago, the beings that we now know as Medabots were the rulers of the Earth. But they were obsessed with battle and war - to evolve and fight, they modified their bodies into robotic, metal, armored forms. But their war decimated both their race and the world, and so the survivors encoded their minds into small metallic hexagons - Medals - so that when the world was returned to life, they might live again, too. But when this race was returned to life, they were no longer what they had been - now they were Medabots. It is within his own memories of this past time that Metabee's mind now resides, as he and Rokushou's former self battle each other as generals of opposing armies. Metabee is forced to kill Rokushou, and then, in a battle with Warbandit's past self, the Medaforce rips across the planet, laying it to waste. Doctor Meta-Evil is determined to return the world under the rulership of Medabots. It is this racial memory that his resonance device has used the power of the rare medals to unlock - all the Medabots remember what they once were, and what they could be again: masters of the world. This is why they rampaged during the Ten Days of Darkness, which were only stopped when Hikaru Agata was forced to kill his Medabot, the first Metabee, by destroying his rare medal and cutting off the meda-energy. Victor is ready to do the same to Warbandit now, but Ikki refuses to let him, then touches Metabee, only to have his mind pulled inside Metabee's dream world. There, he convinces Metabee to return to the real world with him, and they see an image of Professor Hushi, who tells them it's good to see Medabots and humans together. Metabee and Ikki's minds return to the real world, and Metabee is freed from the trance - the fact is, he and Ikki - Medabot and human - like each other! Rokushou too is able to free himself from the trance, and uses the Whitesord to tear down the resonance antennae, freeing all the Medabots minds. Doctor Meta-Evil retaliates with an army of Medabots in his likeness, and the world's biggest, baddest robattle ensues, as all the Medabots take them on! Victor targets Doctor Meta-Evil, but Warbandit takes a deadly hit intended for Victor, destroying his body. Sumilidon unleashes the Medaforce, but overdoes it a bit, cleaving the entire stadium in two, and it begins to plummet to Earth as the Select Corps evacuate everyone - except for Victor, who says with Warbandit's corpse. The stadium crashes, but from it's wreckage emerges Doctor Meta-Evil's trump card... his greatest creation... the gigantic Medabot, Babby-Blue!

Doctor Meta-Evil has unleashed his ultimate weapon - the colossal Medabot, Babby-Blue! But Doctor Aki is ready this time - after the las time Meta-Evil played the giant Medabot card, he had a Giant Metabee constructed. Metabee is unable to generate enough power to mobilize his giant likeness, and realizes that they need - "More Medabots, More Power!" Brass, Peppercat, Neutranurse, Sumilidon, Totalizer, Kantaroth and Cyandog all board the Giant Metabee and help to pilot it into battle with Babby-Blue, in a submission robattle refereed by Mr. Referee, who's determination has been restored by the peddler. But even this combination of strength can't breach Babby-Blue's forcefield. Metabee's determination to win draws on the power of the medals of Medabots from all over, unlocking the dormant power within all medals, both rare and clone. A Medaforce blast generated by this energy shatters Babby-Blue's forcefield, but fails to damage the Medabot itself. Metabee knows what he has to do to win, and ejects all the other Medabots from the Giant Metabee, says his farewells to Ikki, and blasts off, crashing the Giant Metabee into Babby-Blue, creating a huge explosion that destroys them both. But Doctor Meta-Evil has parachuted to safety, and swears revenge... when suddenly, Brandon appears, and tells him enough is enough. Everyone is quite baffled as a massive spaceship descends from the heavens, and Professor Hushi appears in a beam of light projected by it. He makes Doctor Meta-Evil understand that the constant battling is what wiped the Medalorions out in ancient times, and that he needs to let go. Meta-Evil is unwilling, but then, his cat speaks again, and tells him it's time they realized Medabots don't WANT to rule the world any more. The cat's helmet ejects a medal, and the helmet then falls apart, as the cat leaves - all along, the cat was under the control of Miko, a Medalorion who's mind was in the medal. Meta-Evil accepts Hushi's offer to explore space with him, and Hushi leaves Doctor Aki as the guardian and protector of all Medabots. Just before they leave, as a "gift," Metabee is reborn, and everyone is shocked when Brandon sheds his human skin, revealing that he's an alien. Brandon, Hushi and Meta-Evil all depart the planet. As the sun rises, Victor proclaims himself a changed man, and will robattle for honor now - and when he gets a new tin pet, Ikki will be the first one he fights! Henry appears with a new tin pet and Warbandit armor, which Victor inserts Warbandit's medal into. Ikki, Victor, Metabee and Warbandit square off, as Mr. Referee declares - "ROBATTLE!"
